News

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for October

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 2, 2018

This month Lesley will be discussing The Burnt-Out Town of Miracles, by Roy Jacobsen.

Fun Palace events to kick off National Libraries Week

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 2, 2018

Several Suffolk libraries will be hosting Fun Palaces this weekend (Saturday 6 and Sunday 7 October).

Ipswich County Library set for Americana showcase

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 1, 2018

Ipswich County Library’s growing reputation as a live music venue will be enhanced further on Saturday 13 October when the venue hosts a trio of top Americana acts.

Gainsborough Library wins Community Building Award

Written by James Powell · Published Sep 28, 2018

Gainsborough Community Library won the Village Hall or Community Building of the year award in this year’s Community Action Suffolk awards.

Suffolk Libraries holds its sixth Annual General Meeting

Written by James Powell · Published Sep 26, 2018

Suffolk Libraries held its sixth AGM on Tuesday 25 September.

Summer Reading Challenge a success again in Suffolk Libraries

Written by James Powell · Published Sep 25, 2018

Thousands of children across Suffolk have been collecting their certificates and medals from libraries after completing this year’s Summer Reading Challenge.

Have your say on Brandon and Long Melford libraries' proposed new opening hours

Written by James Powell · Published Sep 10, 2018

Suffolk Libraries is asking customers for their views on proposed changes to the opening hours at Brandon and Long Melford libraries.

Take part in OverDrive's Big Library Read for October 2018

Written by Alice Violett · Published Sep 10, 2018

From 1 - 15 October, you can borrow The Girl with the Red Balloon by Katherine Locke on OverDrive without a wait list and join in a worldwide discussion.

Local theatre company to tour Suffolk libraries in October

Written by James Powell · Published Sep 3, 2018

QuirkHouse Theatre Company will be bringing their flagship play, Talking in the Library, to its natural home for Libraries Week 2018.

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for September

Written by Alice Violett · Published Aug 6, 2018

This month Lesley will be discussing The Sealwoman's Gift, by Sally Magnusson.
